channel.title: Highly Improved Chat Log System; Creates a New File Each Day in a Monthly Folder
channel.description:
I love chat logs, but I hate that one huge folder that piles up to the point where your computer literally freezes up when you click to open it. So I decided to create this.
[IMG]http://img714.imageshack.us/img714/1693/loggingpic.png[/img] Every time the month changes, it'll create another folder with the month and year in the title.
[IMG]http://img176.imageshack.us/img176/9489/loggingpic2.png[/img] Every time a day changes, it'll create another .txt file with the day, month, day number, and year in the title.
[IMG]http://img249.imageshack.us/img249/6373/screenshot085.png[/img] Here was me typing on March 29th right before it was about to change to March 30th.
[IMG]http://img444.imageshack.us/img444/407/screenshot086.png[/img] While it changed from 11:59 PM to 12:00 AM, I was typing and it created this second file and logged everything in that file for that day.
Very efficient and organized way of dealing and handling your chat logs. I suggest doing the same to yours.
I was also thinking about logging each player's chat logs by directing all chat said by a certain player into their own chat log file. So in the folder "Individual Chat Logs", it would write in the file titled "Rune Freak10.txt" if the player's name was Rune Freak10. I have still yet to decide if I want to do this, because it will create MANY different files if I do.

item.title: Highly Improved Chat Log System; Creates a New File Each Day in a Monthly Folder
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:9, topic:335109”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=431503.msg3168415#msg3168415 date=1270226755]
This is exactly what cronolog does, but it is more dynamic (you can specify exactly how you want things stored). I use it to keep logs on my web server, you could use it for this too.
[/quote]
That actually looks very nice, I might consider using that!

So I decided to create this.

I wonder where your inspiration came from. ;)[/quote]

I looked at the cronolog, I didn’t really understand it at first…I still don’t fully understand it, but I might understand it after a while.

And, I get a lot of inspiration from listening to music. He might have got it from there as well, or maybe a deadly taco disturbing your stomach during the middle of the night…

Whatever it was, thank god…My chat logs file is: 102.4MB

That’s from over the past few weeks…Consider auto talker a threat…Especially when like 5 mins of auto-talking spam = 2MB

Read full topic

I wonder where your inspiration came from.

item.title: Highly Improved Chat Log System; Creates a New File Each Day in a Monthly Folder
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I love chat logs, but I hate that one huge folder that piles up to the point where your computer literally freezes up when you click to open it. So I decided to create this.


Every time the month changes, it’ll create another folder with the month and year in the title.


Every time a day changes, it’ll create another .txt file with the day, month, day number, and year in the title.


Here was me typing on March 29th right before it was about to change to March 30th.


While it changed from 11:59 PM to 12:00 AM, I was typing and it created this second file and logged everything in that file for that day.

Very efficient and organized way of dealing and handling your chat logs. I suggest doing the same to yours.

I was also thinking about logging each player’s chat logs by directing all chat said by a certain player into their own chat log file. So in the folder “Individual Chat Logs”, it would write in the file titled “Rune Freak10.txt” if the player’s name was Rune Freak10. I have still yet to decide if I want to do this, because it will create MANY different files if I do.
